page.title: 08RECLAIMING HILL LAND.
page.content: There are four stages to reclaiming land.Firstly the useless vegetation must be disposed of.It can be ploughed if the land is level or sprayed to kill the vegetation.Heather can be burnt.The land must then be cultivated and minerals added to improve soil fertility.Lime and phosphates are added to acidic soil. When the land is dry,seeding can take place providing there is enough time for the seeds to germinate before winter.Clover or turnips improve soil fertility Moorland often has its own drainage due to slopes.Drainage is very expensive,so trees are planted instead Reclaiming land is profitable to the farmer as it can increase the stocking rates.Bracken land carries 3 sheep per hectare,whilst reclaimed land carries 22.
